title: June: Campaign Identity
description: Define the campaign’s mission, branding, and public presence through writing, messaging, and compliance practice.

tasks.prompt: Write a newspaper-style article announcing your candidacy.
Create campaign slogans, a mission statement/credo, and outline four key issues with explanations.
Recruit a friend to join the simulator and describe how they will contribute to your campaign team.
Gather and record a real candidate’s FEC information (name, FEC ID, receipts, expenditures, cash on hand, source link).

narrator: Your message and identity are critical. Libertarian candidates must clearly communicate principles such as personal liberty, fiscal responsibility, and limited government.
readingSummary: Building a recognizable identity is essential for voter trust and campaign viability.
Message discipline, branding, and operational awareness are key to gaining approval and credibility.
Activities include campaign announcement, defining slogans/mission, team-building, and opposition research.

tasksDetails.prompt: Write a clear, detailed newspaper-style article announcing your candidacy.
Draft campaign slogans, mission statement, and outline four key issues.
Simulate recruiting a team member and describe their role.
Record real candidate FEC information to practice compliance tracking.

outcome.description: Earn CC and voter approval, establish campaign identity, and gain practice in operational compliance.
